bestBHT.bht: A father wouldn't give his child a dangerous creature, so the scorpion mentioned must not refer to a literal one. Instead, it likely represents something harmful, such as the serpent-like land scorpion that is venomous and mischievous. This interpretation enriches our understanding of the message.

John Gill: Of which there are three sorts; some are terrestrial, or land scorpions, scorpions of the earth, a kind of serpents, very venomous and mischievous..." (36 words)
By it may be meant here, either the fish that is so called, since a fish is mentioned before; or rather, the land scorpion, which is of the serpent kind..." (34 words)
but what father would do so to a child!" (10 words)

bhtAttempts.bht: A father wouldn't give his child a dangerous creature, so the scorpion mentioned in the Bible verse must not refer to a literal scorpion. Instead, it likely represents something harmful, such as the serpent-like land scorpion that is venomous and mischievous. This interpretation aligns with the context of the passage and helps us understand the verse more deeply.
